text.0: glorify thou bṛhaspati the scatheless who must be praised with hymns sweettongued and mighty.
text.1: to whom as leader of the song resplendent worthy of lauds both gods and mortals listen.
text.2: on him wait songs according to the season even as a stream of pious men set moving.
text.3: bṛhaspatifor he laid out the expanseswas at the sacrifice vast mātariśvan.
text.4: the praise the verse that offers adoration may he bring forth as the sun sends his arms out.
text.5: he who gives daily light through this gods wisdom strong as a dread wild beast and inoffensive.
text.6: his song of praise pervades the earth and heaven let the wise worshipper draw it like a courser.
text.7: these of bṛhaspati like hunters arrows go to the skies that change their hue like serpents.
text.8: those god who count thee as a worthless bullock and wealthy sinners live on thee the bounteous.
text.9: on fools like these no blessing thou bestowest bṛhaspati thou punishest the spiteful.
text.10: like a fair path is he where grass is pleasant though hard to win a friend beloved most early.
text.11: those who unharmed by enemies behold us while they would make them bare stood closely compassed.
text.12: he to whom songs of praise go forth like torrents as rivers eddying under banks flow seaward.
text.13: bṛhaspati the wise the eager closely looks upon both the waters and the vessel.
text.14: so hath bṛhaspati great strong and mighty the god exceeding powerful been brought hither.
text.15: may he thus lauded give us kine and horses may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
